rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports factual status ('results will be closely watched', 'data... was mixed').
The segment does not contain a moderate verb paired with significant scale or impact.
This segment reports expectation and past results without explicit calming language.
The segment does not contain a minimiser used in conjunction with a scale contrast.
The segment states results will be watched and data was mixed but contains no bare negation.
The segment reports trial results will be watched, not capabilities or preparedness.
Does not primarily report prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
The segment speculates about future observation of results ('will be closely watched'), not speculation about future relief from the virus.
No direct quote or attributed statement providing a dominant frame.
No explicit framing cues remain; facts presented neutrally.
